snippet.textDisplay:
Actually, 64 in general had a bunch of great, memorable songs.  The Villa, the Castle Center (featured previously in the list), this Clock Tower, Art Tower from LoD, Underground Tunnel (Reinhart's/Cornell's/Henry's path), Tower of Sorcery (Cornell/Carrie), Outer Wall (Cornell/Henry, in a campy sort of Metal Gear Solid way), Tower of Science...

It really did a good job on the ambient front, I'll give it that.  The only really, really weak level in both games, I thought, was the Underground Waterway (Carrie's path.)
snippet.textOriginal:

It really did a good job on the ambient front, I'll give it that.  The only really, really weak level in both games, I thought, was the Underground Waterway (Carrie's path.)

snippet.textDisplay: I had fun with it I'm not going to lie. Although Ive never beat it with the girl. Youre right it had a really great dark atmosphere especially the garden maze. I didnt like the lack of music in the game and the fact that candles dont re spawn. I always had the leather whip because I'd die and the candles wouldnt not respawn to get the upgrade.

snippet.textDisplay: Well I'll say it, I think this game is awesome. Strangely enough, I've come to that conclusion a year ago after I replayed it. They nailed the atmosphere and I had absolutely no problems with the controls, including the platforming parts. I also found the levels quite varied and their design very effective. In the end, the heavy dark atmosphere is what made this game so memorable to me. As for the music, it's far from being as catchy as the 2D Castlevanias', but it managed to fit the game very well. This ambient theme is one of my favorites in the game, with just enough melody to make it stand out.
snippet.textOriginal: Well I'll say it, I think this game is awesome. Strangely enough, I've come to that conclusion a year ago after I replayed it. They nailed the atmosphere and I had absolutely no problems with the controls, including the platforming parts. I also found the levels quite varied and their design very effective. In the end, the heavy dark atmosphere is what made this game so memorable to me. As for the music, it's far from being as catchy as the 2D Castlevanias', but it managed to fit the game very well. This ambient theme is one of my favorites in the game, with just enough melody to make it stand out.

snippet.textDisplay: +ShadowSumac someone replied without hate or fury?  It's a Christmas miracle!!!
snippet.textOriginal: +ShadowSumac someone replied without hate or fury?  It's a Christmas miracle!!!

snippet.textDisplay:
+SupraDarky Ditto.


CV64 was created quite different from other games in the series, past or present, and is very unique, which, understandably, might not be not a cup of tea for everyone. Under shell of outdated graphics, hides a very atmospheric and interesting experience, which have been never replicated in the series since then. 


Though, there are some problems with controls and camera, they are not as  bad, as some people say. It's gameplay take some time time to used to, but reward is a very peculiar strong experience.
In my personal rating I put this game above most of the post-Symphony games, including SOTN itself. I am talking about original CV64 version.

snippet.textDisplay:
I also loved this game!!!!


It was my first castlevania, and I was Hooked from the Start.


In fact, My ControllerPak (N64's Memory Card) broke and I was happy to play through it again (I alway liked to re-battle final bosses from time to time)

snippet.textDisplay:
Wow, I'm not alone! I actually also liked the game. I recognize it's flaws, but it did such a great job regarding the atmosphere that this alone was enough to keep me playing. The gameplay stopped being a problem after I got used to it and in the end I was really enjoying the journey.

I recall having A LOT more fun with this game than I did with Lament of Innocence. That one was such a bore...
snippet.textOriginal:

I recall having A LOT more fun with this game than I did with Lament of Innocence. That one was such a bore...

snippet.textDisplay: I couldn't agree more.  I fell in love with this the first time I played it.  Granted, it took some getting used to.  However, I feel that this game NAILED the atmosphere of being on Dracula's castle grounds and in his castle itself.  The bosses were larger than life and it was hard.  A Castlevania game should be hard.  Thank you for posting this and standing behind this gem of a game.
snippet.textOriginal: I couldn't agree more.  I fell in love with this the first time I played it.  Granted, it took some getting used to.  However, I feel that this game NAILED the atmosphere of being on Dracula's castle grounds and in his castle itself.  The bosses were larger than life and it was hard.  A Castlevania game should be hard.  Thank you for posting this and standing behind this gem of a game.
